perturbation.original_text: 1.10 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means, with respect to a Party’s specific obligations under this Agreement, that level of efforts and resources, [***]. Commercially Reasonable Efforts requires that the applicable Party: (i) [***], (ii) [***], and (iii) [***].
perturbation.changed_text: 1.10 “Commercially Reasonable Efforts” means, with respect to a Party’s specific obligations under this Agreement, that level of efforts and resources deemed appropriate by the Party making the effort.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific requirements for 'Commercially Reasonable Efforts,' the definition becomes subjective. This creates uncertainty because the contract relies on this term for key obligations. If, for example, Zogenix fails to meet supply obligations, they could argue their efforts were 'commercially reasonable' under their own interpretation, even if objectively insufficient. This weakens the distributor's ability to enforce supply commitments.

perturbation.original_text: 1.26 “Fully-Burdened Manufacturing Cost” means the costs incurred by Zogenix that are directly attributable to and reasonably allocated to the manufacture and delivery of the Product to Distributor. Fully-Burdened Manufacturing Costs shall include the following: [***].
perturbation.changed_text: 1.26 “Fully-Burdened Manufacturing Cost” means the costs incurred by Zogenix related to the manufacture and delivery of the Product to Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the components that make up the Fully-Burdened Manufacturing Cost, this change will introduce ambiguities into calculating the transfer price and could cause disputes. With such ambiguity, Zogenix could inflate the costs, affecting distributor profits.

perturbation.original_text:
1.43 “Net Sales” means, with respect to any period of time, the gross amounts invoiced for sales or other dispositions of the Product in the Territory by or on behalf of Distributor or its Affiliates or Sub-distributors to Third Parties (other than Sub-distributors) during such period, less the value added taxes levied on or measured by the billing amount for the Product to the extent included in the gross invoiced sales price for the Product or otherwise directly paid or incurred by Distributor or its Affiliates or Sub-distributors, as applicable, with respect to the sale or other disposition of the Product, less the following deductions to the extent actually allowed, paid, incurred or accrued during the applicable period, calculated in accordance with Japan GAAP or IFRS (consistently applied):
[***]
Net Sales shall be calculated in accordance with Japan GAAP or IFRS, consistently applied in the Territory and shall be consistent with net sales reported in Distributor’s audited financial statements. If net sales reported in Distributor’s audited financial statements include discounts for products sold in combination or bundled with other products, these discounts will not be included in the calculation of Net Sales of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.43 “Net Sales” means, with respect to any period of time, the gross amounts invoiced for sales or other dispositions of the Product in the Territory by or on behalf of Distributor or its Affiliates or Sub-distributors to Third Parties (other than Sub-distributors) during such period, less reasonable deductions. Net Sales shall be calculated in accordance with accounting standards, consistently applied in the Territory and shall be consistent with net sales reported in Distributor’s financial statements.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific deductions and accounting standard (Japan GAAP or IFRS) from the definition of Net Sales, this change introduces ambiguity. The contract references Net Sales for milestone payments and royalty calculations. 'Reasonable deductions' is subjective and opens the door for disputes over what can be deducted, creating uncertainty in enforcement and potentially reducing payments to Zogenix.
